intro: Pedicularis legendrei, commonly known as the Legendre's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling orchids. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
